title: Growth chambers could enable reproducible plant-microbe data across continents
description: Harnessing the power of artificial intelligence to study plant microbiomes—communities of microbes living in and around plants—could help improve soil health, boost crop yields, and restore degraded lands. But there's a catch: AI needs massive amounts of reliable data to learn from, and that kind of consistent information about plant-microbe interactions has been hard to come by.

title: Intel forecasts first-quarter sales and profit below estimates
description: Intel forecast first-quarter revenue and profit below market estimates on Thursday, as it struggles to match ‌supply to booming demand for traditional server chips used in artificial intelligence data centers.
content:
Intel shares were down 7% in after-hours trading.
Sign up here.

title: Google offers users option to plug AI mode into their photos, email for more personalized answers
description: Google is leveraging its artificial intelligence technology to open a new peephole for its dominant search engine to tailor answers that draw upon people's interests, habits, travel itineraries and photo libraries. The new option rolling out Thursday will give millions of people the option of turning on a recently introduced…

title: Lawmakers want to give creators a way to find out if their work was used to train AI.
description:
A pair of bipartisan lawmakers introduced the Transparency and Responsibility for Artificial Intelligence Networks (TRAIN) Act in the House, letting copyright holders see if AI models were trained on their work. It’s already been introduced in the Senate, and counts the Recording Industry Association of America and SAG-AFTRA among its endorsers.
[Link: Dean, Moran Introduce Bipartisan Bill to Protect Creators from Unauthorized AI Training | https://dean.house.gov/2026/1/ean-moran-introduce-bipartisan-bill-to-protect-creators-from-unauthorized-ai-training | Congresswoman Madeleine Dean]

title: Optimizing for the Age of AI: How RENTAL12 Built a "Machine-Readable" Hospitality Ecosystem
description: In December 2025, RENTAL12—Sardinia’s only fully owner-operated short-term rental company—launched a new iteration of its digital ecosystem. While most hospitality brands focus solely on human-centric design, RENTAL12 has engineered its platform to be fluently understood by the next generation of digital gatekeepers: Artificial Intelligence, Large Language Models (LLMs), and Answer Engines. title: Forget DeepSeek, Dying Alone Is China’s Latest Tech Obsession
description: This time last year, the hottest Chinese tech product was DeepSeek’s market-moving artificial intelligence model. In 2026, it’s something far simpler: an app for people worried about dying alone.
content:
This time last year, the hottest Chinese tech product was DeepSeek’s market-moving artificial intelligence model. In 2026, it’s something far simpler: an app for people worried about dying alone.

title: Firms must invest in real people to gain from AI, EY's Teigland says
description: Companies will not get productivity gains from artificial intelligence unless they invest in real people and redesign how work is done, Julie Teigland, EY's global vice chair, told Reuters on Thursday.
content:
DAVOS, Jan 22 (Reuters) - Companies will not get productivity gains from artificial intelligence unless they invest in real people and redesign how work is done, Julie Teigland, EY's global vice chair, told Reuters on Thursday.
